intro: Actinella lanata, commonly known as the woolly actinella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that covers its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species within its native range.
